conclusion: Analyze forces on each block using Newton's second law to find static friction on block D
Total force F applied to block B
Acceleration a is given by a = F/m_total
Total mass of system is m_total = m_B + m_C + m_D + m_A
Block A in contact with block B
Force on block A is static friction f_AB
Block B in contact with block C
Force on block B is static friction f_BC and spring force F_s
Block C in contact with block D
Force on block C is static friction f_CD
Block D not in contact with any other block
Force on block D is static friction f_DA
For block A, f_AB = m_A a
For block B, F - f_AB - F_s = m_B a
For block C, F_s - f_BC = m_C a
For block D, f_DA = m_D a
Spring force F_s is same for blocks B and C
Static friction forces must be consistent with spring force
Static friction force on block D is f_DA = m_D a
Static friction force on block D is f_DA = F * m_D / m_total
Blocks are identical and forces distributed equally
Static friction force on block D is f_DA = F / 4
Final answer is f_DA = F / 4
